description: Accounting Ethics uses concrete examples and case studies, including current situations such as the Enron/Arthur Andersen debacle, to examine the ethical responsibilities of individual accountants as well as accounting firms. Offers a comprehensive overview of ethics in accounting, as well as an examination of and recommendations for solving the current crisis in this field. Investigates the nature and purpose of accounting. Uses concrete examples and case studies, including current situations such as the Enron/Arthur Andersen debacle. Examines the ethical responsibilities of individual accountants as well as accounting firms .
title: Accounting Ethics
